page.title: 04Landscape of the Ufton Area.
page.content: The basic rocks are of {KEUPER MARL} below the escarpment and Lower Lias above, sloping to the South East. Local quarrying by the cement industry has been carried out for the shallow White Lias. The landscape of the 12 sq.km.grid is dominated by the limestone escarpment which runs diagonally from the S.W corner to the N.E corner.From this there is a fine view over the arable farmland in the valley to the West.The escarpment itself is dominated by the village & about a sq.km. of woodland.From here the ground slopes gently Eastward & once again becomes arable farmland.To the South earlier quarrying has left its marks in the shape of pools & rough ground.To the North the GRAND UNION CANAL briefly enters the area.
